about: Winter is coming, we know what's coming with it. We can learn to live with the wildlings, or we can add them to the army of the dead. But if that's not enough, then consider this: if the Night's Watch are truly brothers, then Lord Commander Mormont was our father. He lived and died for the Watch and he was betrayed by his own men, stabbed in the back by cowards. He deserved far better.

position.full: King in the North, Lord of Winterfell

education.school: Student of Maester Luwin & Ser Rodrick Cassel

experience.description:
• The Dothraki do things in their own time, for their own reasons. May the Father judge him justly.
  • You know nothing, Jon Snow. Dunc the Lunk, thick as a castle wall.
  • Can a man still be brave if he’s afraid? That is the only time a man can be brave.King in the North.
  • Words are like wind.
  • What is dead may never die.

experience.position: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch
experience.description:
• When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die.
  • Can a man still be brave if he’s afraid? That is the only time a man can be brave.
  • A forked purple lightning bolt, on black field speckled with four-pointed stars.

• Forgive my manners. I don't see many ladies these days. Lucky for the ladies. Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken. Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken.
  • The tourney of Ashford Meadows. And now his watch is ended. When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die.
  • And now his watch is ended. Bastards are born of passion, aren't they? We don't despise them in Dorne.
